Federal Communications Commission
Page 5
entertainment) shown by stations more directly under university
control and financing, although we concede that there are notable
exceptions to this statement. However, we doubt that the proposal
to delete ten-watt stations will improve programming, unless the
Commission also devotes more attention to the methods of financing
and supervising of college and university stations. It may well
be that the latter would be more effective in achieving programming
improvements than would the proposals for higher power.
Gene E. Stebbins
Department of Speech
